note.p: Death: Sandford Orleigh, near Newton Abbot (30 December 1893)
Burial Place: Ashes buried at Grimley, near Worcester

Career: Travelled to Ceylon (1845-1854); established an agricultural settlement at Nuwara Elliya; oversaw railway construction from the Danube to the Black Sea (1859); explored the sources of the Nile with his second wife; searched for and found the Great Lake Albert Nyanza (1864); accompanied the Prince of Wales to Egypt and the Nile (1869); commanded an expedition organized by the Pasha of Egypt to suppress slavery and annex the Equatorial regions of the Nile basin (1869-1873); explored Cyprus (1879)
Obituaries: Proc Roy Soc 1894 vol 55 pp xxxiv signed by J K
